name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

location.address: 15K, Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025, India

organizer.name: Bengaluru by foot
organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: The Indian Cacao & Craft Chocolate Festival 2025
description: India's first and biggest craft chocolate festival celebrating homegrown chocolate makers, cacao farmers, and artisans who are uplifting the community together, joined by industry experts and international guests! Come and taste unlimited chocolate, meet the makers, celebrate with the community, and attend free workshops or sign up for what you like via our Instagram!

organizer.name: The Indian Cacao & Craft Chocolate Festival
organizer.description: The Indian Cacao & Craft Chocolate Festival was born after 5 years of exploring farms and makers across India. We aim to unite them, celebrate India’s unique cacao, and raise awareness by connecting farms, makers, and consumers for the growth of Indian-origin chocolate.

name: Harry Potter Book Discussion
description: For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Soumik Datta | Travellers
description: Soumik Datta | Travellers Award-winning sarod musician and composer Soumik Datta blends ambient soundscapes, spoken word, and Indian classical roots to create an experience that is both emotive and immersive. With the evocative voice of the sarod at its heart, Travellers is a sonic journey that layers field recordings and immersive sound design with live music that stretches time and pulses between memories, transporting audiences across the invisible borders that divide land, places, and people. This performance is part of Soumik’s Melodies in Slow Motion Tour, a seven-month journey across India that brings his music to concert halls, homes, heritage sites, juvenile centres, national borders, and schools, interacting with marginalised communities that often go unheard. This show is presented by Culturegrind.Credits: Sarod & Composition - Soumik Datta Violin - Sayee Rakshith Tabla - Debjit Patitundi Mridangam & Percussion - Sumesh Narayanan “Travellers” is co-produced by Soumik Datta Arts, G5A In Residence & Arts Council England.  Entry only on advance ticket booking.Seating on first come first serve basis.Gates open at 6.45 PM.NO PARKING at the venue. Parking only at Westside or Dickenson Road.

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Vrindaban, Present Please
description: An Interactive play written and performed by Somudranil SarkarAbout the play "Vrindaban, Present Please" is an immersive, one-man interactive play set in a rural Indian village, where Samiran Banerjee, a Kolkata teacher, is transferred to a village school after a Supreme Court ruling. Assigned to a chaotic school once led by the mysteriously absent Salma Khatoon, Samiran's efforts to restore order only lead him deeper into unsettling events. From a water shortage to a snake in his room, his attempts to connect with the eccentric villagers only intensify his isolation. But behind it all, Samiran harbors a secret—someone named Vrindaban. Why does he hide this figure? Is it the only refuge in a world that refuses to understand him? The play unravels questions about isolation, hidden truths, and the blurred lines between personal and professional life.About the artist:  Somudranil Sarkar, a theatre maker from kolkata. He has over 25 years of experience in theatre and has had the privilege of training under some of the most respected names in the Bengali theatre circuit, including Rudraprasad Sengupta, Swatilekha Sengupta, Debshankar Halder, Sohini Sengupta, and Goutam Halder in Nandikar. He has also trained in mime under the guidance of mime guru Jogesh Dutta. Over the years, he has directed and acted in over 100 plays and curated various theatre workshops for diverse groups. Somudranil has received the Azhar Alam Young Director’s Award for his contribution to the field.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Making My Storybook
description: Workshop for Children by Shloka K.Colors for the characters, words for the story, plain white pages to be filled with your child’s creativity.“Making My Storybook” is a hands-on book-making workshop for parents and their 3-5 year olds. This isn’t just doodles and colors, it’s a peek into your child’s world. A world shaped by everyday observations and experiences. This workshop opens up space for open-ended conversations with your child that may reveal cues about their interests, thoughts, and needs.So, join us for an hour filled with colors, conversation, and creativity - and walk away with a storybook that’s uniquely yours.Takeaways from this workshop:- A storybook illustrated and authored by your child- An hour of conversational creativity- Insight into your child’s current interests and needs- Moments of bonding and joy with your child

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group”
description: Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R. People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Food In Literature Book Club
description: Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of foodliterature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, todifferent cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but toeach other as well.So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for adialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month withPrachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.October Read: Desi Delicacies. Edited by Claire ChambersWe assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; acommunity for people who to love to read and eat!When: Saturday, 25th October, 2025 at 11 a.m.Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira NagarAges: 18+Registration is mandatory : https://t.ly/BO6wVCopies of the book are available at the store.

name: Georgette Heyer Reader Meetup
description: “Georgette Heyer Reader Meetup”A Group discussion for Literature EnthusiastsSun, 26 Oct 2025, 11 AMGeorgette Heyer's blend of humor, clever dialogue, a brisk moving plot, historical accuracy and, of course, romance, is an absolute delight for all readers. You can escape into a world of leisure, populated by broad-shouldered noble lords and witty ladies who dreamt of love over a marriage of convenience ...Often set in Regency-era London, these novels revolved around the lives of the wealthy upper classes – society’s ton and their quirks.Whether you are a fan of many years or someone who is just starting out reading her novels you are more than welcome to join us to discuss and marinate in her world...

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: The Analog Club: Diwali Edition
description: This Diwali, step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no one taking selfies, and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter! For this special Diwali Edition, you can expect festive food and drinks, themed activities, and a space to celebrate the season in true analog style. Optional Dress Code: Come dressed in your best festival fit! Come dressed to celebrate!**We will not be using social media on our phones at the event; we will only take photos with a camera.**Strictly no devices (no laptops, iPads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and nowhere on a table. E-books are allowed)**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours.

name: Atta Galatta presents “Let Poetry Be”
description: This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!Date: 25th OctTime: 4pm Venue: Atta Galatta, IndiranagarEvent specifics & submission guidelines –1. Theme - Blue (any original work)2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live3. All languages welcome4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 23rd Oct midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for -Oct LPB meet-up '7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.comYou are now welcome to flood our inbox!

name: ALT EFF 2025 <> Opening Weekend
description: In a world where the old stories of domination over nature no longer hold, we stand at a crossroads: regeneration or collapse. What will be (y)our legacy?The legacy we leave behind will be shaped by the strength of our community.Join us for the opening weekend of the All Living Things Environmental Film Festival’s 6th edition as we take over BIC in Bengaluru. It’s a weekend-long celebration packed with stellar cinema, immersive art experiences, workshops, filmmaker Q&A, and delicious food and drinks included in your ticket price! There is something for everyone, so bring your family, bring your friends and meet the kind of community you’ve been waiting for. See you there!

name: A Halloween Special with Boo! Ya Watchin
description: As a lover of all things horror, if there’s a Boo! Ya Watchin? screening you shouldn’t miss, it’s a horror film. After hosting several Halloween special screenings, including a special premiere of Longlegs with PVR in Bangalore last year, she’s back with a cult classic this month, Rec (Spanish). The special evening includes the screening of this 73-minute nail-biter (with an unpredictable ending 👀) and will be followed by a special performance by DJ Rishi Sippy, with the perfect tunes to boogie the scares away. Expect a custom cocktail menu, pass around snacks and more. So show up in your best Halloween costume, enjoy a movie & end your Sunday evening with a dance party! Note: Gates open at 7pm and the screening will begin at 7:30pm. We request all our guests to arrive on time for us to begin the screening as planned. The dance party will start at 9:45pm post the screening and mixer.Boo! Ya Watchin?, the brainchild of Mahima. V is a Bangalore-based film screening series that turns cult classics and hidden gems into shared, immersive experiences.  REC (2007) is a Spanish found-footage horror film directed by Jaume Balagueró and Paco Plaza. The story follows TV reporter Ángela Vidal and her cameraman as they cover a routine night shift at a fire station—until a call to an apartment building turns their night into a nightmare. Shot in real-time with a claustrophobic, handheld style, REC delivers relentless tension and scares across its tight 75-minute runtime. While its intensity may not resonate with everyone, it’s widely regarded as one of the most terrifying found-footage horrors ever made.Rishi Sippy is a Bangalore-based DJ and is the brain behind beloved dance IPs in the city like Jackfruit Dance Party & Freak Opera. Rishi's performances are dynamic and immersive, fluid journeys that blend hypnotic minimalism with raw, driving energy. At Urbanaut, we're building unique and niche experiences in collaboration with our ever-present partners. Invite yourself to one — or three — or hit us up with ideas and collaborations!Ladies Who Loiter is a celebration inspired by leisure, love and art. Carefully curated by some incredible women, this is our little love letter to ladies everywhere to add more leisure, lightness, play and art into their lives.

location.address: 37th, Crescent Hotel, Crescent Rd, High Grounds, Gandhi Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Urbanaut Experiences
organizer.description: At Urbanaut, we're building unique and niche experiences in collaboration with our ever-present partners. Invite yourself to one — or three — or hit us up with ideas and collaborations!

name: Mandala Magic Workshop
description: Slow down for a few mindful hours with us as we explore the meditative practice of mandala art. In this guided session, you’ll learn to draw your own intricate, balanced patterns — one line at a time — and experience the quiet focus that comes with this beautiful, rhythmic process.Each participant will create a set of small mandalas that can be transformed into charming bookmarks, gift tags, or luggage ties — tiny tokens of calm you can carry with you.The session will be led by Usha Murthy, who has been practicing and teaching this art form for nearly a decade. Usha has conducted Dottin Mandala workshops in the U.S., and her work beautifully bridges the ancient roots of this practice — from Australian Aboriginal dot art to the Buddhist and Indian traditions of circular mandalas symbolizing life and harmony. To get a glimpse of her work, find her on Instagram @dottinmandalas.Her teaching style is gentle, step-by-step, and highly visual — a truly sensory experience. The workshop will be conducted in English, with Hindi support if needed.No prior art experience is required — just bring your curiosity and a willingness to slow down. All materials will be provided.Join us for a peaceful morning of art, conversation, and mindfulness — right in the cozy corners of our bookstore café.

name: Unmask the Art: Cherial Mask Making Workshop
description: Celebrate Traditional Indian Craftmanship with Dr. Sai PrenathyImmerse yourself in the vibrant world of Cherial masks, renowned for intricate designs and storytelling. Join our workshop to explore the history, significance, and craftsmanship of these iconic masks.Cherial masks are a traditional Indian art form originating from Cheriyal village in Telangana's Warangal district. These vibrant masks are a modified version of Nakashi art and are known for their intricate designs and storytelling.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Familiar Strangers
description: A workshop by Saachi & PragyaEvery day we encounter countless people, some friends, some strangers. Among the friends and strangers, there are familiar strangers: the people who appear regularly in our daily paths yet remain largely unseen.This student-led workshop is built around using fiction to better understand these familiar strangers through noticing, mapping, and reimagining. Come sit, chat, and build new characters with us.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: RANIs of INDIA - Lores of the Queendom (Bangalore)
description: RANIs of INDIA is a collection of stories from various oral, folk, mythical and historical narratives collected based on numerous travel and research over the last few years on the lesser-known or completely forgotten women rulers of this wonderful country by Vikram Sridhar . Over one hour, through oral story-telling smattered with folk songs , we travel the country, going deeper into many stories of Indian queens from myths, history and present times, whose stories need to be told and heard.From North to South, East to West there have been women rulers, administrators, changemakers who have changed and touched history and our heritage strongly.About Vikram SridharVikram Sridhar is a Performance Storyteller, TEDx Speaker, Theatre Practitioner.and a Narrative based Facilitator combining his various interests and work over 20+ years in Theatre, Conservation and Social Work. He believes in the Desi way of Storytelling as a strong medium of conservation from nature to human relationships as his stories are rooted in Folklore, Heritage and Ecology inspired from various communities of the soil . He strongly believes `A Story a Day keeps the Doctor Away ` not an apple

name: Climate Talks, Bengaluru
description: Hi there,​We are elated to extend an invitation to you to join us as we discuss 'The Effects of Climate Change on Farming'. ​The Session includes Talks by an esteemed panel of Speakers. ​This will be followed by a networking break for you to connect and explore collaborations or simply converse with our Speakers and fellow attendees to explore areas of mutual interest. We look forward to seeing you there. ​For any further queries, contact - ​Aashi Agarwal, Head of Engagement, Planet Pact​Selva Ganapathy, Co-founder & Head of Community, Planet Pact​Stay tuned to our socials for further updates: LinkedIn | Instagram

name: Dot Mandala Candle Holder
description: Celebrate the Festival of Lights creatively at Fired Up Studio! Join our Diwali Dot Mandala Candle Holder Workshop in Bangalore and experience a mindful art session where you’ll learn the soothing technique of dot painting to design your own stunning votive or tea light holder—perfect for brightening your festive decor or gifting something handmade.Perfect for beginners and craft lovers alike, this hands-on workshop will guide you step-by-step through patterns, color combinations, and brush control—no prior experience needed! Take home a glowing handmade décor piece to brighten your Diwali celebrations or gift it to someone special.✨ When: Wednesday, October 15 | 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM✨ Where: Fired Up Studio, Whitefield, Bangalore✨ All materials provided

name: Frosted Artistry: Intricate Cake Decoration
description: Unleash your creativity and learn the art of intricate cake decoration in this hands-on workshop at Fired Up Studio, Bangalore. Whether you’re a baking enthusiast, a DIY lover, or looking for a unique weekend activity, this workshop will teach you professional techniques to transform simple cakes into stunning edible works of art. From delicate piping, floral designs, to elegant fondant details, you’ll gain the skills to impress at any celebration.Hands-On Learning: Step-by-step guidance from expert instructors.All Materials Provided: Just bring your enthusiasm—icing, tools, and practice cakes are included.Perfect for All Skill Levels: Beginners and hobbyists will leave with confidence and beautiful creations.Ideal for solo participants, friends, couples, or families looking for creative experiences in Bangalore. Book your spot now and make your cake designs truly unforgettable!

name: UrbanGro Hydroponics 101
description: ​Curious about growing your own clean toxin-free food but don’t know where to start?​​Join us for a hands-on hydroponics workshop where you’ll learn everything you need to start your growing journey right from your balcony.​​🌱 What we’ll cover:​​Basics of hydroponics (what why how)​​Choosing the right system for your space​​Mixing nutrients for optimal plant growth​​Plant care maintenance & troubleshooting​​Live demo and hands-on participation​​🎁 Bonus:Each participant will go home with a hydroponic self-watering house plant to get started right away.​​💸 Fee: ₹800📅 Date: Saturday October 4th🕒 Time: 3 PM – 6 PM📍 Location: Atlantis Sanctuary 👥 Limited Seats: Only 10 spots available!Only 2 wheeler parking available.Join @urbangronchain on Instagram and Twitter!

name: Halloween Evening : Children’s edition
description: The hottest party in town is here ! 🎉🎃 PopClub presents Kids Only Halloween Party. The one-of-its-kind, exclusive Halloween event curated for children PopClub' - Children exclusive experience club brings an unforgettable evening designed specially for children aged 8–14 — an evening where children can dance, laugh, experience and celebrate their way in a safe, vibrant, Indoor and fully supervised environment.🧙‍♂️ Dress Code - Halloween themed costume🪩 DJ + Dance Floor – A high-energy DJ party with disco lights and music, giving kids a real party vibe — no adults allowed!🎤 Live Beatbox & Performances – Experience electrifying entertainment from young talent and live performers.🍕 Delicious Treats & Snacks – Fun, food made for children.📸 Unlimited fun  - Games, entertainment & more❤️ Our Commitment: PopClub ensures a safe, inclusive, and joyful experience for every child. Your cooperation and timely communication help make the event magical for all!Important note🚗 Drop-off & Pick-up: Must be done by a parent or authorised guardian with valid ID verification at the gate; please ensure timely pick-up after the event.⚠️ Safety & Conduct: Activities are staff-supervised; children must follow rules and act responsibly. Misconduct may lead to removal without refund.🍕 Food & Allergies: Food and refreshments will be provided; parents should inform organisers in advance of any allergies or dietary restrictions.

name: Geist Brewing × Muttley Crew - ‘Bone’ Appétit BBQ!
description: Geist Brewing Co. × Muttley Crew present ‘Bone’ Appétit BBQ!Fire up the grills 🔥We’re serving BBQs, brews & good vibes — for hoomans and dogs!A first-of-its-kind community event celebrating good beer, four-legged friends & smokey flavours! Get your tickets now!⸻🍔 What’s on the MenuFor Hoomans:Food and beverages for hoomans will be available à la carte from Geist Brewing Co.Geist Brewing Co.’s Skewers Edition featuring:🌶️ Thai Tofu🍗 BBQ Buffalo Chicken🥩 Bulgogi Buff🦐 Garlic Butter Prawn🌭 Geist Uncle Dunkle-Basted Bratwurst🍽️ Plus a full lunch menu, a variety of craft beer options, and signature cocktailsFor Top Dogs:Muttley Crew’s exclusive BBQ Menu featuring:🥩 Paneer & Pumpkin Skewer🍗 Chicken & Sweet Potato Skewer🐮 Beef & Apple Skewer🍺 Bone Broth “Beer” topped with foamy egg white🍔 Sliders (₹300 each)⸻🎨 What Else Is in Store🐾 1:1 Consultation with Canine Nutritionist Mithun (Krypto Kanine)🎨 Live caricatures for dogs & pet parents by Murali🎨 Paw-painting corner for pups⸻💛 Event Details📍 Venue: Geist Brewing Co. OMR 📅 Date: 26th October🕓 Time: 1 PM – 4 PM🎟️ Tickets: ₹500 per pet dog (Geist food & beverages à la carte)⸻🧠 About the ArtistsMithun (Krypto Kanine)A certified Canine Nutrition & Behavior expert who’s helped over 800 dogs live happier, healthier lives through balanced, wholesome diets.📍 @kaninenutritionMurali (Artist & Caricaturist)Renowned for his expressive pet caricatures and on-the-spot art for pet parents.📍 @artistmurali

name: Hand Embroidery Workshop
description: About the WorkshopUnwind from your busy schedules and join me for an enchanting Hand Embroidery Workshop. Hand embroidery is more than just a craft – it’s an experience.Why attend?Learn a Mindful, Timeless SkillEmbroidery slows you down in the best way possible. It’s a meditative, hands-on way to unwind from busy schedules.Connect with Creativity & CommunityYou’ll meet others who share a love for handmade art and be inspired by the group's collective energy.Take Home Something You MadeAt the end of the session, you’ll have a small, hand-embroidered piece – a keepsake of your effort and creativity.Date: October 25, 2025, Saturday Time: 4 to 6 PMAge: 15+Fees: INR 1,200/- This workshop includes all the materials.Each participant gets a cotton tote bag to embroider, which they will take back home.

name: Kannada Jamming for Kannada Rajyotsava
description: 🎶 Aaroha the band Presents: Kannada Jamming for Kannada Rajyotsava 🎶  This Kannada Rajyotsava, let’s come together to celebrate the spirit, culture, and soulful music of Karnataka! 💛❤️ Join Aaroha the Band for a special Kannada Jamming Session – an evening dedicated to the melodies that define our land. From timeless classics to contemporary hits that echo across generations, Aaroha brings you a heartfelt musical journey in the language of our roots. ✨ Highlights of the Event: 🎵 Soulful Kannada songs and unplugged renditions 🎤 Sing-along moments with the audience Let’s celebrate Kannada Rajyotsava not just with words, but with the universal language of music. Come, sing, sway, and feel the pride of being a Kannadiga! 📅 Date: 2nd November  🕒 Time: 6pm to 7:30pm 📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar  Let the beats of Karnataka’s heart resonate through every chord and every voice. Aaroha the Band invites you to be part of this musical tribute to Namma Kannada Nadu! 💛❤️

name: Kayaka: Live at Sabha BLR
description: India, circa 11th century. A shoemaker writes about the difficulty of changing society. A weaver ruminates on the value of work. A burglar rhymes about identifying the true jewels in life. A sex-worker writes searing lines about caste, as an offering to her 'shameless' deity... Kayaka ('work') is a musical ensemble that blends ancient progressive poems and writings with contemporary music. Led by renowned Bangalore musicians MD Pallavi and Bruce Lee Mani, the material for this acoustic concert is drawn mainly from the Vachanas. Winner of the prestigious 'Vachanasri Award', Pallavi has been working with this material for a long time. Adding Bruce's guitar, compositional skills and genre-fluid approach results in a stirring collaboration - where Western acoustic folk, blues, world music and jazz mingle freely with Indian folk and classical styles - all with hard-hitting, lyrics that have lost none of their power, even after 800 years!

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Second Act: Redesigning Your Career and Your Heart
description: Second Acts: Redesigning Your Career and Your Heart.HerKey x RSVP Escape Let’s Meet Over Coffee (For Single Women)📅 Wednesday, 15th October🕔 5:00 PM onwards📍 The Kind Roastery and Brew Room Indiranagar, BangaloreHerKey, India's largest AI-powered platform dedicated to unlocking women's earning potential, partners with RSVP Escape, a curator of immersive experiences and community-led events, Let’s connect, build a community, and create meaningful connections.The TalkA 45-minute talk exploring how career reinvention and opening yourself to love require the same courage. Drawing from personal experience and connections with hundreds of women through RSVP Escape, discover why pursuing both professional fulfillment and personal connection isn't selfish, it's essential. Learn practical strategies for navigating vulnerability in job interviews and first dates alike.This isn't a dating seminar, it's a conversation about thriving after life's curveballs and giving yourself permission to design a fulfilling second act.The HerKey LENS ProgramThrough its LENS Program (Learning, Engagement, Networking, and Showcase), HerKey empowers women to take charge of their careers and financial independence. The program offers personalized growth journeys, expert-led sessions, and powerful community connections that transform aspirations into achievements.What You'll ReceiveOn being a part of the Community, you gain access to:HerKey LENS Program Benefits:Curated opportunities for learning and professional development through the platform.Engagement with industry experts and mentors.Networking with accomplished, like-minded women.RSVP Escape Community Membership:Access to the exclusive RSVP Escape singles community. Priority invitations to all RSVP Escape events for immersive dining and social experiences held monthly.Connecting with other singles to network, build personal relationships and friendships to enhance your social circle.

name: Tarot & Intuition
description: Step into an afternoon of soulful reflection and intuitive discovery with Anuradha Shukla — celebrated Tarot reader, life coach, and author of “The Intuitive Edge: A DIY Tarot Guide for Smarter Decisions in Love and Business.”In a world full of noise, this gathering offers a quiet, meaningful space to reconnect with your inner wisdom. Through the ancient art of tarot, Anuradha gently guides participants to explore their emotions, clarify decisions, and realign with life’s deeper flow.The session will feature:Personal Tarot Readings – short, insightful sessions offering clarity and directionReflections on Intuition – understanding how to listen to the voice withinGuided Conversations – linking tarot symbolism with everyday choicesEnergy & Awareness Exercises – simple ways to ground and center yourselfWhether you seek answers about love, career, or personal growth, this event invites you to pause, reflect, and trust your intuition. The experience is designed to help you leave lighter, calmer, and more attuned to your own path.Come with curiosity, stay with openness, and leave with a renewed sense of clarity.Join us at Atta Galatta on 2nd November for an afternoon where spirituality meets insight — and where the tarot becomes a mirror to your soul.

name: Alchemy with Art
description: Ever had that feeling that you are hungry for something more even though your tummy is full? What you truly crave is nourishment, of a deeper kind. At this workshop, you are shown how to make fun sacred and channel straight from your heart. To connect with the part of you that already has all the answers you seek. You are taught creative ways to look within and connect to your own magic. There will be mini soulful rituals, creative play, heart openers and deep listening to recharge you like never before.

organizer.description: **Here’s a condensed version of the text:**  THE Park, Bangalore is a luxury boutique hotel with 109 rooms. It offers various dining options like Monsoon (seasonal Indian cuisine), Aqua (poolside dining and tequila bar), Tap Room (craft beer), and I-Bar (cocktail lounge and nightclub).

name: Diwali Supper Soirée: A Night of Finding Home
description: Can’t go home for Diwali?Don’t worry, Sugar & Spice is bringing home to you minus the nosy aunties and the “beta shaadi kab” committee 😌We start at 7:30pm on 18 October 2025Picture this: a long table dressed in warm candlelight, marigolds tumbling over silk runners, and tiny diyas flickering between bowls of edible art. The air smells like cardamom and laughter.Welcome to my Pre-Diwali Supper Soirée — an evening for strangers who’ll leave as friends (and possibly fight over the last matar paneer taco 🫢).Expect:🍴 Gourmet Indian dishes that feel like nostalgia with a modern twist and memories on a plate.🎲 Games and giggles that melt away awkwardness faster than hot gulab jamuns.🌼 A tablescape that glows — handcrafted decor, flickering candles, and soft jazz meeting the scent of ghee.🪔 And somewhere between the first bite and the last toast, “missing home” quietly turns into “feeling at home.”Come hungry. Leave glowing — from good food, warm hearts, and new memories made under golden light. 💛

location.address: 108/M, Kalpana Chawla Rd, Bhoopasandra, R.M.V. 2nd Stage, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560094, India

name: Pint of View (Lecture 8): Lights On, Birds Off?
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where lectures meet drinks in a relaxed pub-style setting.For our 8th lecture, we’re bringing you Anusha Shankar, a National Geographic Explorer and wildlife scientist at TIFR Hyderabad. Anusha will take us on a journey into the secret lives of these tiny but remarkable birds. How do hummingbirds survive overnight mini-hibernation? How do nightjars navigate the urban landscape of Hyderabad? Join Anusha to explore these questions and more in Lights On, Birds Off? (Stories of Hummingbirds, Sunbirds & Nightjars), a session full of fascinating science and insights you won’t hear anywhere else. All of this, over a complimentary Geist beer or mocktail at the gorgeous Jamming Goat 3.0 in Indiranagar.What to Expect:🐦 A 45-minute session blending engaging wildlife science with interactive discussion🧠 15–20 minutes of Q&A to ask your questions and dive deeper into the research🍹 A 30-minute mixer to chat, share insights, and connect with fellow attendees🍺 One complimentary beer or mocktail included with your ticket🍕 An à la carte menu available throughout the evening✨ Science, stories and conversations you won't forgetEvent Details:📅 Sunday, 19th October | 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar🎫 Limited to 80 attendees only💰 Early bird pricing available for first 10 ticketsAbout the Lecturer:Anusha Shankar is a National Geographic Explorer and wildlife scientist at TIFR Hyderabad. She studies hummingbirds, sunbirds, and nightjars, uncovering how they balance energy in challenging environments. Through storytelling and fieldwork, she brings science to life for audiences everywhere.About Pint of View:Pint of View is inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S. We are bringing this format to India finally. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

location.address: 2010 PID- 74-1, 1st & 2nd floor, 2010, 100 Feet Rd, Hal, second stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

organizer.name: Pint of View, Bengaluru
organizer.description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where cutting-edge science meets craft beer. Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap movement in the US, Pint of View is bringing this revolutionary format to India for the very first time.

name: NRI Homecoming Meetup: Halloween Edition
description: This Halloween, join us for a spooky-exclusive gathering of ex-NRIs and visiting NRIs from SF, NY, London, Singapore, and beyond. We had a fantastic event in BLR and BOM, and now we’re bringing the magic to BLR again — with a Halloween edition!🧛‍♀️ Dress Code: Come in your best Halloween look (costumes compulsory — from playful to scary 👀). Judgement free!Hosted by Nupur (@nupur.nri) and the Zero1 Network (by Zerodha), this evening is all about discussing, ranting, sharing challenges, and finding your tribe in a warm, relaxed space.Expect:✨ Halloween fun✨ Coffee & snacks included✨ Meet folks from top startups, FAANG companies, and impactful leaders📝 Apply to Attend: Attendance is by application only to keep it high-quality. You HAVE To have been an NRI or Current NRI. Non-NRIs will not be allowed.

name: Sparks & Stories: A Diwali Night
description: This Diwali, join us for a night of celebration - with music, laughter, and stories shared with people you’ll truly vibe with ✨From diyas & sweets → to karaoke jams, retro Bollywood mashups, and stories that spark new friendships — this night is all about connection, music, and memories you’ll carry home.There’s also a one-of-a-kind Flash Jam hosted by @yourthird_place & @the.dani.verse! An iconic groovy mashup of Shape Of You and Naina (Diljit Dosanjh) followed by a fun musical retro game - all of it sung by you!Join us over for the most unique Diwali celebration in Bangalore.
